articles.title: Kim Il Sung Street in Phnom Penh put into better shape
articles.content:
Friendly meeting with Syrian delegation
    Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- A friendly meeting with the delegation of the Revolution's Youth Union of Syria was held here on Monday.Present there were secretary Kim Kyong Ho of the c.c., the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League and other officials of its central committee.Members of the delegation of the Revolution's Youth Union of Syria led by vice-chairman Muhammad Imad al Zououbi on a visit to the DPRK and charge d'affaires ad interim of Syria Basal al-Ha Hussein attended it.  Officials of the two youth organizations deepened their friendship, conversing with each other and singing together.

articles.title: Pyongyang invites South Korean figures
S. Korean worker's struggle for right to existence
articles.content:
Pyongyang invites South Korean figures
   Pyongyang April 20 (KCNA) -- A consultative meeting of executive officials of the Council for National Reconciliation was held in Pyongyang on Monday.   The meeting discussed a number of practical issues related to the implementation of the decision of the second plenary meeting of the council.   It was decided at the meeting to hold a "meeting to remember Mr. Kim Ku" in Pyongyang on coming June 26, the 50th anniversary of his assassination and invite figures of various circles  in South Korea including those who attended the historical April north-south joint conference with him.

articles.title: 1st Kimilsungia Show closes
articles.content:
S. Korean worker's struggle for right to existence
    Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- The South Korean  Confederation of Trade Unions on April 18 declared that it would call a massive general strike for the vital rights of the workers, according to reports.  It said that over 25,000 workers affiliated with 22 trade unions would immediately enter into a strike when the Seoul Subway Trade Union calls a general strike on April 19 and more than 80,000 workers associated with 35 trade unions including the Pusan Subway Trade Union and the "Korea Telecommunications" Trade Union would join them till April 26.   It declared in order to give momentum to the struggle rallies would be staged in various parts of South Korea simultaneously till may day including an unemployed rally on April 24.   Earlier on April 15, it called on workers, farmers and the poor to intensify their solidarity actions.

articles.title: Joint performance of art troupes of DPRK and Russian armies
articles.content:
1st Kimilsungia Show closes
   Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- The 1st Kimilsungia Show which had opened to commemorate the 87th birth anniversary of the President Kim Il Sung closed on Monday.   More than 260,000 people visited it during the period.   At the closing ceremony commendations were awarded to the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, the Ministry of Public Security and the central committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, other organizations and working people, soldiers and youth and schoolchildren who made distinguished contributions to the success of the show.   In his closing speech chairman Jang Chol of the Kimjongilia Federation of Korea stressed that Kimilsungia is the revolutionary flower which instills national dignity and pride into the Korean people and inspires them to renew their pledge to struggle for the accomplishment of the Juche revolutionary cause.

articles.title: Balderdash of U.S. refuted
articles.content:
Joint performance of art troupes of DPRK and Russian armies 
    Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- A joint performance of the merited choir of the Korean People's Army and the Russian Alexandrov Army Choir and Dance Ensemble was given at the Mansudae Art Theatre on Monday.   The program of the performance which began with the Russian side's chorus "Song of General Kim Il Sung," a  revolutionary paean of Korea,  included Korean and Russian songs and dances and other pieces.    The two art troupes composed of many famous people's and merited artistes were acclaimed by the audience for giving the performance of high ideological and artistic level.

articles.content:
Meeting of Hanchongryon deputies  suppressed
    Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- The South Korean authorities put down a meeting of deputies to the 7th-term South Korean Federation of University Student Councils (Hanchongryon) scheduled to be held at Hongik University, at the point of the bayonet, said a Seoul-based radio.They stationed 11,000 policemen of 96 companies at major universities, including Hongik, Yonsei and Korea universities, from April 16 to suppress the students,  kicking up a search racket.   The students under Hanchongryon launched a protest demonstration despite crackdown by the authorities.     On Sunday over 900 protesters met at Seoul Railway Station to check the South Korea-U.S. joint wartime reinforcement drill and denounced the U.S. imperialists and the authorities for the north-targeted war exercises.

articles.content:
Anti-"government" struggle declared in S. Korea
    Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- The South Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) on Monday held a rally for declaring a general strike with some 15,000 unionists and students in attendance, according to a radio report from Seoul.Chairman of the KCTU Ri Kap Yong declared that they would wage an anti-"government" struggle, saying that the authorities have driven the situation to a catastrophic phase by refusing  dialogue and negotiation.The participants raised 4-point demands including suspension of "restructuring" and layoff and guarantee of the negotiating system of the trade unions under the KCTU.

articles.title: Delegation of World Council of Churches leaves
articles.content:
Greetings to Algerian president-elect
   Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings to Algerian president-elect Abdelaziz Bouteflika on April 18.   The message expressed the belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would continue to develop favourably and sincerely wished him  great success in his responsible work for the national unity and the prosperity of his country.
